title: Textile, 1800–1900
medium:
Medium: 
Technique: plain weave with complementary wefts and inner warps (taquete)
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 50.8 x 33.8 cm (20 x 13 5/16 in.)
description: Fragment of a pattern featuring courtly entertainment with man seated on throne, two male servants, bowls of fruit or sweetmeats, and a dancer. An interior setting is indicated by pillars and drawn back curtains. Sad colors in roses and blue on what was once a gold background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1800–1900.Medium: 
Technique: plain weave with complementary wefts and inner warps (taquete). 1938-26-5.
